title: Obtain a Bachelor's Degree
description: A bachelor's degree from a university recognized by the University Grants Commission (UGC) of Sri Lanka is the mandatory minimum educational qualification to sit for the key public service examinations.

title: Succeed in the Open Competitive Examination
description: This is the most critical and challenging step. You must prepare for and pass the highly competitive open examination for recruitment into a premier government service, such as the Sri Lanka Administrative Service (SLAS) or the Sri Lanka Foreign Service (SLFS).
qualifications: High marks in the competitive examination
institutes: Private institutes offering classes for competitive exams

title: Post-Recruitment Training
description: Upon successful selection, you will undergo a rigorous training program at the Sri Lanka Institute of Development Administration (SLIDA) or a similar institution. This training covers public policy, financial regulations, management, and administrative procedures.
salaryRangeLKR: Initial government salary scale for the service

title: Assistant Secretary / Assistant Divisional Secretary / Third Secretary
description: Begin your career in a junior executive role. In the SLAS, you might be an Assistant Divisional Secretary managing a local government area. In the SLFS, you'd be a Third Secretary in a foreign embassy or the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
institutes: Various government ministries, Divisional Secretariats, Sri Lankan embassies abroad

title: Senior Government Official (Secretary, Ambassador)
description: Through promotions based on seniority and performance, you can rise through the ranks to become a head of a government department, a Ministry Secretary (the highest civil service position), or an Ambassador representing Sri Lanka overseas.
